reviewText:
Winnetou has been perhaps the most popular youth story in the world since the 1880s - yes, for about 130 years! I have not met a mainland European who is not familiar with this story of the American West. In this series, the hero is the American Indian - and above all, Winnetou,  the young, brave, noble chief of the Mescalero Apaches.

Like we discovered soccer in the last 30 years, perhaps it is now time to for Americans to discover this great, romantic story about the West in the 1860s.
